description.narrative:
In December 2011, Agriterra, in the person of Mr. Rien Geuze and Cees van Rij, performed a scoping mission to Aberdare SACCO. During this and other visits of Mr. Geuze there were extensive talks with the manager. Based on this a company assessment was recommended.
This company assessment was carried out from 1-5 October, 2012 by Erni van Wingerden and Roel Lammerts. The objective was to jointly develop an action plan/strategy for the further development of Aberdare SACCO. This project is a result of that company assessment.
Roel Lammerts and Erni van Wingerden executed the company assessment. They recommended:
It is recommended to develop a SMART strategic plan and invest in training and education of the Board of Directors the management and staff, in order to enhance the overall performance of the SACCO. To improve the efficiency of the SACCO it is recommended to computerize the administration of the two branches.
To Agriterra we recommended to support Aberdare SACCO for one year. In one year much can be done to strengthen the SACCO and making it possible that Aberdare SACCO continues on the positive track it is now on. With a clear SMART strategic plan and matching operational plan it will be easier to convince third parties to provide external capital at a good interest rate. In view of the current interest rate on loans in the market it is advisable to discuss the possibility of adjusting the SACCO interest rate on agricultural and business loans as this may lead to profitable access to external capital.
Carrying out the action plan will lead to an enhanced performance of Aberdare SACCO, at least 25% of the loan portfolio by the end of 2014, compared to the loan portfolio at December 31, 2012 and an increase in active membership from 3,000 at the end of 2012 to 4,000 the end of 2014.
Develop a SMART strategic plan. Invest in training and education of the Board of Directors the management and staff, in order to enhance the overall performance of the SACCO. Computerize the administration of the two branches.
